rComments: Will always remember Professor Savage as one of my favourite lecturers at U of T during my undergrad. He was so passionate about teaching and showed real enthusiasm about the material. If youre reading this Professor thanks for being so cool & dont let academia kill your passion!! Lol
The best history class I've ever taken at U of T was with him. Extremely kind and really cares about his students. Quick with marking too! Would highly recommend taking one of his classes if you can

A nice person, and approachable, but terrible as a professor. His lectures aren't well informed and viewpoints are bias. Unaccepting of differing viewpoints. He assigns too many readings, and some don't relate to lecture
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: Savage was super approachable and always willing to talk to his students. He returns assignments very quickly, and clearly prioritizing teaching. He is a very fair grader and makes his expectations known and reasonable. Also one of the most phenomenal lecturers I've ever had - he presents with unparalleled clarity and enthusiasm. Highly Recommended
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: Great professor. Teaches in an entertaining, but informative way (in a 2 hour lecture I would have 5 pages of typed notes). Funny guy, marks really quick which is really nice.
teacherRatingTags: ['Beware of pop quizzes', 'Amazing lectures', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Terrible prof. Uses a great deal of bias to the point that there is limited objective learning that a student will intake.
Really nice, fair grader, easy course if you keep up with lectures. Great guy.

Really nice and attentive and his lectures are my favourite this year. I always look forward to his class on Fridays because he's such a great speaker and the content is really interesting. He also deserves the chili pepper - pretty cute in a nerdy way. Just another reason to show up hehe
Best prof I've had at U of T- so fair and kind! He gives a lot of reading but it is always interesting and he goes over information thoroughly in lectures. Would recommend his course to anyone.
